pages.text: This wondrous device is a modified $(item)soul cage$(). It harnesses the souls within a $(item)soul crystal$(), to produce that entity's drops directly, instead of spawning them.

pages.title: Requirements
pages.text: To operate, this construct requires eight $(item)pylons$() of any type, an inventory such as a $(item)chest$() or $(item)barrel$(), and $(thing)power$().$(br2)Once all requirements are fulfilled, the revitalizer will begin working upon being given a $(item)soul crystal$() of sufficient $(thing)tier$().

pages.title: Tiers
pages.text: Much like the $(item)soul cage$(), the revitalizer's effectiveness is dependent on the $(thing)tier$() of your provided $(item)soul crystal$(). As the two devices are almost exactly the same in this regard, I shall not repeat myself on this matter, refer to the entry for the soul cage.

pages.title: Pylons
pages.text: The revitalizer's attributes can be changed by using different $(item)pylons$(). These can do anything from increasing the energy efficiency of the device, to allowing it to produce experience from its work. The following pages shall list how to use the $(thing)pylon focus structure$() to create them, and what their effects are.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)dragon head$() to create a beheading pylon. This pylon increases the chance of obtaining heads from entities, but at an increase in power consumed. Up to three can be positioned on a revitalizer.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)netherite ingot$() to create an effiency pylon. This pylon lessens the amount of power consumed from the revitalizer device, and one can place up to five at once.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf an $(item)enchanted golden apple$() to create a looting pylon. This pylon increases the $(thing)looting level$() of the revitalizer, at a cost of increased power consumption. One revitalizer may have up to three.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)rabbit's foot$() to create a speed pylon. This pylon increases the $(thing)work speed$() of the revitalizer, at a cost of increased power consumption. At most five may be placed on one device.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)sculk catalyst$() to create an experience pylon. This pylon increases the $(thing)experience gains$() of the revitalizer, at a cost of increased power consumption. At most three may be placed.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)blaze rod$() to create a flame pylon. This pylon $(thing)burns$() mobs conjured by the revitalizer, at a cost of increased power consumption. Only one may be placed.

By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)nether star$() to create a recursive pylon. This pylon provides a fifteen percent chance to $(thing)add a soul$() to the contained $(item)soul crystal$(), at a steep power cost. Only one may be placed in the revitalizer structure.
